intro: Solori pseudorobusta, commonly known as the false blackwood, is a woody shrub or small tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
